result.execSummary:
The defendant Melvin Young Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay the DNA surcahrge, plus costs and disbursements.  Court ordered monies to be taken from prison funds not to exceed 25%.   Balance to be paid while on Extended supervision with supervision fees. Failure to pay amounts in full would result in a civil judgment entered against defendant which is nondischargable in bankruptcy.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Seek and maintain employment.  Be given job and vocational training.

No controlled substances or alcohol.
No contact with Tiffany S. or Fernando W. or their residences.
AODA assessment, treatment if needed.  Urine screens.

supervisions.notes:
Provide DNA sample.
The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms; further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Melvin Young Jr

records.addlTxt:
The Petition for Sentence Adjustment is denied because it is not in the public interest.

-  The court has reviewed the defendant's petition for sentence adjustment as well as the documents he and others submitted in support of his petition. The court concludes that sentence adjustemnet is not warranted at this time. In particular, the court finds that the defendant has not shown his ability to conform his conduct to rules and expectations, as evidenced by his reconfinement after he was released to extended supervision, and by the major conduct violation he incurred as recently as July of 2021. The court concludes that under these circumstances, the full term of confinement is needed

-  signed by the Court (electronically)

Copy mailed to defendant
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Mark A. Sanders, Br. 28, calendar successor, for review. cmc
Defendant's Petition for Sentence Adjustment.  (Melvin Young, Jr. - #558926, Oakhill Correctional Institution, PO Box 938, Oregon WI 53575).

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Signed Earned Release Program/Substance Abuse Program Order mailed to SUPERINTENDENT SKALSKI ST CROIX CORRECTIONAL CTR P.O.BOX 36 NEW RICHMOND WI  54017

Whereas, the defendant entered and began participation in the Earned Release Program on 3.16.16.

Whereas, the defendant has successfully completed the Earned Release Program of 9.12.16.

It is ordered that the Department of Corrections will effectuate the change from Confinement to Extended Supervision upon receipt of this order, determining the actual number of days served in Confinement and changing the remaining Confinement to Extended Supervision.  The number of days that are converted from Confinement Time to Extended Supervision will be determined by DOC Central Records, and will be based upon actual release date.

It is further ordered that the Warden/Superintendent of the institution to which the prisoner is assigned shall effect his or her release within 6 working days upon receipt of this order.

In all other respects, the original judgment herein is affirmed.
DOC is requesting the Court to authorize the inmate's release and conversion of remaining confinement time to extended supervision.  Assigned to Br. 7, Judge McAdams.  jm
records.descr: Pet/determ eligibility for substance abuse program

records.addlTxt: Original Transcript (34 pages) GUILTY PLEA/SENTENCING HEARING commencing August 14, 2014, received and filed.

Attorney Mary G Guimont in court.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Due to the lateness of the hour, Court ordered case adjourned for plea/sentencing hearing in Branch 21.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 14, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Alexis R Liggins in court, defendant Melvin Young not in court, in custody.  Tyrone M St Junior for Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter calendared for Plea/sentencing hearing.  Parties advised that Branch 21 is in jury trial in an unrelated matter and unable to hear this matter on today.  New date selected with the parties as spin court not available.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 7, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Alexis R Liggins in court, defendant Melvin Young not in court, in custody.  James Griffin for Lucy J Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.
Parties engaged in plea negotiations. Defense requests date for possible resolution of this matter.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 5, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Alexis R Liggins in court, defendant Melvin Young not in court, in custody.  Jesica A Ballenger for Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.
 Scheduling conference held between counsel.  Parties engaged in plea negotiations.  Defense awaiting offer.  Status conference scheduled for May 1, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.  Original Information received and filed.  Copy given to Defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty.

Defendant Melvin Young in court with attorney Alexis Ray Liggins.  Defendant Melvin Young in custody.  Tyrone St. Junior for Lucy J. Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Yamahiro.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Brash, Br. 21.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 11, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for 04-01-2014 at 01:30 pm.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

As an additional condition of bail:
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Tiffany S.  AND/OR  Fernando W.   AND/OR  their residences   AND/OR  their places of employment

Defendant Melvin Young in court with Attorney Alexis Ray Liggins.  Defendant Melvin Young in custody.  Timothy J. Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Yamahiro, Branch 34.
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
Court orders case adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.

Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
